contextId.information: "his powerful word." Here "word" refers to a message or command. AT: "his powerful command" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "right hand" refers to a place of honor. AT: "he sat down in the place of honor next to the Majesty on high" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: he sat down at the right hand of the Majesty on high

contextId.information: Here "name" refers to honor and authority. AT: "as the honor and authority he has inherited is superior to their honor and authority" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: as the name he has inherited is more excellent than their name

contextId.information: Here "scepter" refers to the Son's rule. AT: "And you will rule over the people of your kingdom with justice" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: The scepter of your kingdom is the scepter of justice

contextId.information: Here "transgression" and "disobedience" stand for the people who are guilty of these sins. AT: "every person who sins and disobeys will receive just punishment" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: every transgression and disobedience receives just punishment

contextId.information: Here "world" refers to the people who live there. And "to come" means that this is the world in the next age after Christ returns. AT: "the people who will live in the new world" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

Here "word of God" refers to anything that God has communicated to humanity whether through speech or through written messages. AT: "the words of God are living" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: the word of God is living

contextId.information: "to God's throne, where there is grace." Here "throne" refers to God ruling as king. AT: "to where our gracious God is sitting on his throne" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "the days" stands for a period of time. And, "flesh" stand for Jesus's earthly life. AT: "While he lived on earth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: During the days of his flesh

contextId.information: Here "takes" stands for "drinks." AT: "drinks milk" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

People trained to understand something are spoken of as if the ability to understand had been trained. AT: "who are mature and can distinguish between good and evil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: who because of their maturity have their understanding trained for distinguishing good from evil

contextId.information: This means the power of God when his kingdom is fully present in all the world. In this sense, "the powers" refer to God himself, who holds all power. AT: "learned how God will work powerfully in the future" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: the powers of the age to come

contextId.information: Here "increase" stands for give descendants. AT: "I will give you many descendants" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The idea of human descent is spoken of as if it had only to do with the flesh of one's body. AT: "on the basis of the law about who his family is" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: on the basis of the law of fleshly descent

contextId.information: Here "the law" is a metonym that stands for God, who established the law. It was according to the law the Israelites appointed their priests. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "Majesty" refers to God, and "throne" refers to God's rule as kin. AT: "of God, who is our majestic king" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: of the throne of the Majesty

contextId.information: This stands for the people who committed these unrighteous acts. AT: "to those who did unrighteous acts" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "cherubim" means figures of two cherubim. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Possible meanings are 1) "the outer room of the tabernacle was still standing" or 2) "the earthly tabernacle and the sacrificial system still existed." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: the first tabernacle was still standing

contextId.information: Here "flesh" refers to the physical body. AT: "rules for the physical body"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "flesh" refers to the entire body. AT: "for the cleansing of their bodies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: for the cleansing of their flesh

contextId.information: Here "conscience" refers to a person's feeling of guilt. Because Jesus sacrificed himself, believers no longer have to feel guilty for the sins they have committed because he has forgiven them. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The death of animals sacrificed to God is spoken of as if it were nothing but blood.  AT: "the death of animals sacrificed to God" (See: [[:[[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

Here "blood" refers to the death of the animals sacrificed to carry out the covenant's requirements. AT: "the blood that brings into effect the covenant" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

Here "shedding of blood" refers to something dying as a sacrifice to God. This double negative can mean that all forgiveness comes through the shedding of blood. AT: "Forgiveness only comes when something dies as a sacrifice" or "God only forgives when something dies as a sacrifice" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])
contextId.quote: Without the shedding of blood there is no forgiveness

contextId.information: The creation of the world is spoken of as if the world were a building and the foundation was the first part to be constructed. AT: "since God began to create the world" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

Here "right hand" refers to a place of honor. AT: "he sat down in the place of honor next to God." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:heb:01:01|1:3]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: he sat down at the right hand of God

contextId.information: Here "blood of Jesus" refers to the death of Jesus. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"faithful hearts" or "honest hearts." Here "hearts" stands for the genuine will and motivation of the believers. AT: "sincerely" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

If the translator understands this phrase as referring to Christian baptism, then "water" is literal, not figurative. But if water is taken as literal, then "pure" is figurative, standing for the spiritual purity that baptism is said here to accomplish. The "washing" stands for the believer being made acceptable to God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: our bodies washed with pure water

contextId.information: Here "blood" stands for Christ's death, by which God established the new covenant. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
That is, permanent foundations. So the city is to be a permanent city. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "world" refers to the people. AT: "The people of this world were not worthy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "right hand" refers to a place of honor. AT: "he sat down in the place of honor." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:heb:01:01|1:3]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: sat down at the right hand

contextId.information: Here "hearts" represents a person's thoughts and emotions. AT: "discouraged" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "in the flesh" refers to a human person. AT: "natural fathers" (UDB) or "earthly fathers" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

Here "voice" refers to someone speaking. The phrase "be spoken" can be stated in active form. AT: "or where God was speaking in such a way that those who heard him begged him not to speak another word to them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: nor to a voice that speaks words whose hearers begged that not another word be spoken to them

contextId.information: Here the trust in God and the way of life led by these leaders are spoken of as "their faith." AT: "Trust and obey God in the same way they do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "foods" stands for rules about food. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

Here "altar" stands for "place of worship." It also stands for the animals that the priests in the old covenant sacrificed, from which they took meat for themselves and their families. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This stands for "outside the city." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "word" stands for a message. AT: "the encouraging message" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
